intro: Odina oghigee, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers and thick, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Odina oghigee is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
